intro: Elatostema cyrtandrifolium var. daweishanicum, commonly known as the Daweishan Elatostema, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
